title: Subtraction Property of Inequality
text: First, we can subtract $$\frac{3}{4}$$ from both sides of the inequality. This gives us $$a+\frac{3}{4}-\frac{3}{4}=\frac{7}{10}-\frac{3}{4}$$.

title: Simplify
text: Then, simplify both sides of the inequality. This gives us $$a \geq \frac{-1}{20}$$.

title: Interval Notation: Parentheses and Brackets
text: In interval notation, brackets are used when the left or right sides of the interval are included in the solution. For example, the expression $$\"x \leq -1\"$$ includes all numbers less than or equal to -1. Since -1 is included in the solution, the interval notation is $$(-\infty,-1]$$. Since $$\infty$$ represents $$\"\infty\"$$ and is not an actual number, we always put a parenthesis next to $$\infty$$.
